clusters.name: JavaScript Asynchronous Concepts
clusters.description: This cluster covers the fundamental mechanisms and common patterns for handling asynchronous operations in JavaScript, crucial for understanding modern web development.

items.reason: This item is foundational for understanding how JavaScript executes code asynchronously. A solid grasp of the Event Loop is a prerequisite for correctly comprehending subsequent asynchronous patterns.

Building directly on the Event Loop, this item introduces the primary patterns for managing asynchronous operations (callbacks, Promises, Async/Await), which are essential for writing non-blocking and maintainable JavaScript code.
